page.title: 01Marldon, Compton, and area.
page.content: The area is agricultural, with red soil. Marldon is the residential area. Across the n.w runs the main railway line to Plymouth. On the east runs the Torquay ring road. There are hills, lanes, and "green lanes", used by walkers and horses. The highest point is "Blue Mountain", in Marldon, at 511 feet. From the block streams go in all directions. Most of the area is in the South Hams District, the NW in Teignbridge, and a small area near the Ring Road in Torbay. Marldon has about 650 homes, and there are 48 in Compton. Most of Marldon has been built since 1950, with small bungalows and a large retired population. There are about 2000 people in the area. Marldon is 2 miles from the sea. It is 3 miles from Torquay. There are shops, a bus to Paignton, school, church, chapel & 2 pubs
